content.description:
There are three newer routes in the broken-up cliff section between Jungle Wall and Hurricane Wall; Yo-Yo is the left-most of these.

Climb up a broken slab with a few bulges to the large roof.  Escape from under the roof to the left (crux) and to anchors above.
content.location: Yo-Yo is the left-most of three new routes in the cliff section between Jungle Wall and Hurricane Wall

content.description: Climb carefully up and left of a corner through some less-than-perfect rock and up the nice headwall to the top of the cliff. There is a still a lot of loose rock on this one, so tread lightly!
content.location:
It is located just around the corner to the right of

Monkey Spunk

.

content.description: There is no major crux here but constant stemming to some crimpy holds and juggy ones throughout. This is a very fun climb and a warm-up for the surrounding routes.
content.location: This is located in a dihedral, downhill from a small cave on the left.

content.description: Fun, blocky, face climbing leads to a huge roof. Pass the huge roof with huge moves on huge holds! As Tom describes, "climb the face then over the huge roof using monkey moves".
content.protection: 6 bolts.  Rap the route. There is a chain anchor.
content.location: This is the farthest right route on the Jungle Wall. This is a really great wall with tremendous views and a collection of great 5.11 & 5.12 sport routes!

content.description:
There are three newer routes in the broken-up cliff section between Jungle Wall and Hurricane Wall; Jambalaya is the middle of these.

This is a mixed-gear route with some interesting moves.
content.location: Jambalaya is the middle of three new routes in the cliff section between Jungle Wall and Hurricane Wall

content.description: Climb up through a series of roofs with fun moves throughout and a big dyno at the top!
content.protection: 6 bolts (not 5 as the guide states), shuts.
content.location:
This is 30' left of

Monkey Spunk

.

content.description: There are three newer routes in the broken-up cliff section between Jungle Wall and Hurricane Wall; Easy Street is the right-most of these; on the wall just left of Monkey Dance.
content.protection: 3 bolts + gear; anchor. Â The first and second bolts are a long distance apart and there's a bomber crack that takes gear, small to medium stoppers or cams.
content.location: Easy Street is the right-most of three new routes in the cliff section between Jungle Wall and Hurricane Wall.

content.description: Steep start with great holds. Turns roof with some difficulty. Take a deep breath, apologize to your feet preemptively, and step right and up to 30' of desperate slab climbing!
content.location: 3rd route (from left) on the Jungle Wall.

content.description:
This is a short 5.10a route to the left of

Show Pony

. The crux is down low.
content.location:
It is left of

Show Pony

.

Lower or rap.
